value.directionText: Your request must be in line with Family Procedure Rules part 25 and Practice Direction 25C. Give other parties a list of names of suitable experts.

Make an application to the court if you believe any party or witness needs help with:

- understanding proceedings and their role in them in court
- putting their views to the court
- instructing their representatives before, during and after the hearing
- attending the hearing without significant distress

If possible, include in your application:

- why the party or witness would benefit from help
- the kind of help that would benefit them the most in giving evidence or participating, and is practically possible
- written confirmation from any relevant witnesses of their view
value.directionType: Request help to take part in proceedings

value.directionText:
Serve requests for disclosure on any third parties, for example the police or a hospital.

If you plan to ask for a disclosure order at the case management hearing, let the third party know in writing. Include a copy of this order.

Anything disclosed in this case is confidential. It cannot be shown to any third party without the court's permission.
Parties and their legal representatives must attend the pre-hearing and hearing
Contact anyone who might want to be a carer if your preferred plan proves to be impossible. Give their contact details to the Local Authority.

caseData.dateSubmitted: TO BE FILLED WITH VALID DATA
caseData.submittedForm: TO BE FILLED WITH VALID DATA

value.directionText: At all hearings, the court must arrange an interpreter for [Respondentâ€™s Name] in [Language].
All of the advocates who will appear at the related hearing must attend.
Send to the court and all parties.
value.directionType: Send the guardian's analysis to all parties

caseData.dateAndTimeSubmitted: TO BE FILLED WITH VALID DATA

value.directionText:
Send a written statement to the court and all parties, showing:

- the parents' response to the local authority's threshold statement
- the parents' proposals for placing the children, immediately and long-term
- whether they agree to a family group conference if one has not taken place yet

If the parents do not do this, the court can assume they do not disagree with allegations in the threshold statement.
value.directionType: Send response to threshold statement to all parties

value.directionText:
If you object to the disclosure request, attend the case management hearing or write to the court to explain your objection.

Anything disclosed in this case is confidential. It cannot be shown to any third party without the court's permission.
value.directionType: Object to a request for disclosure

caseData.submissionConsentLabel: I, kurt@swansea.gov.uk (local-authority), believe that the facts stated in this application are true.

value.directionText:
Give all parties access to all documents sent to the court, including:

- the application form
- annex documents
- evidential checklist documents
- any documents sent later on

- Social work chronology
- Social work statement
- Family tree (genogram)
- Social work assessment
- Care plan
- Threshold document
- Index of checklist documents
value.directionType: Send missing annex documents to the court and all parties

value.directionText: Contact the parents to make sure there is a complete family tree showing family members who could be alternative carers.

Send documents to [Respondent's Name] in [Language], including the application and genogram.

This must include documents that the local authority relies on to support allegations and explain why they have made their application for an order.
value.directionType: Send translated case documents to respondents

value.directionText: It must comply with practice direction 27A from Family Procedure Rules 2010.
Send to the court and all parties.
value.directionType: Send case summary to all parties

value.directionText:
The court has jurisdiction, based on all of the relevant law and facts, for example habitual residency. 

If there is an issue, consider it urgently. Ask the relevant state authority for information needed to decide where jurisdiction lies. Bring this information to the case management hearing at .

If the child is a foreign national, tell the consulate or embassy in writing that these proceedings are happening. Invite any representations to be made to the court.
value.directionType: Urgently consider jurisdiction and invite any representations
